title: Magic pull away, beat Celtics despite another big Jaylen Brown game: 8 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Jaylen Brown scored 32 points, but the Celtics lost to the Magic 123-110, their first NBA Cup defeat.
Payton Pritchard hit five 3-pointers, ending with 27 points, improving his overall 3-point shooting performance for the season.
The Celtics' defense allowed 38 and 39 points in the first and fourth quarters, struggling against the Magic's shooting.

title: Public reprimand recommended for judge accused of helping immigrant escape ICE
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Judge Shelley Joseph recommended for public reprimand for creating an appearance of impropriety in a 2018 ICE incident.
The Massachusetts Commission on Judicial Conduct finds no evidence Joseph authorized a defendant's escape from ICE custody.
Federal charges against Joseph were dropped in 2022 after agreeing to a state investigation into the misconduct allegations.

title: Alex Cora still high on Red Sox’ future a month after being eliminated by Yankees
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Red Sox exited 2025 playoffs after losing to Yankees in AL Wild Card Series, winning one of three games.
Shortstop Trevor Story opted into his contract, while Alex Bregman opted out, leaving Boston's roster situation uncertain.
Manager Alex Cora remains optimistic about future, noting team gained valuable experience and expects improvement in 2026.

title: Giant blade breaks off Mass. wind turbine
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: A wind turbine blade detached and fell into a cranberry bog in Plymouth, Massachusetts, with no injuries reported.
The 75 to 100-foot blade was found several hundred feet from the turbine at 810 Head of the Bay Road.
The turbine entered fail-safe mode upon blade detachment, and the incident is under investigation by officials.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'The Fantastic Four: First Steps' is streaming on Disney+, bringing Marvel's superheroes back in a newly crafted film.
'Frankenstein' by Guillermo del Toro, a unique take on Mary Shelley's novel, is available on Netflix.
'Materialists' featuring Dakota Johnson and Pedro Pascal explores romance tropes, now streaming on HBO Max.

title: Stefon Diggs reveals what he’s trying to improve about himself after 11 years in the NFL
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Stefon Diggs aims to improve his attitude during his 11th NFL season with the New England Patriots.
Diggs leads Patriots in receiving yards, targets, and receptions, contributing significantly to a six-game win streak.
Diggs credits offensive coaches for fostering growth and providing opportunities for all players to excel.

title: Commuter train plows through car on tracks in Acton
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: A commuter train hit an empty car at Central Street crossing in Acton; no injuries reported.
The driver exited the car before the crash, and the vehicle was pushed 300 feet by the train.
The crash caused delays on Fitchburg line; transit police investigating and driver will be cited.

title: What to know about possible Red Sox free agent target Munetaka Murakami after posting
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Munetaka Murakami, known as the 'Japanese Babe Ruth,' has been posted by the Tokyo Yakult Swallows for MLB signing.
Murakami, a top hitter with a history of high home runs, is a potential Red Sox target if Alex Bregman departs.
MLB teams interested in Murakami include the Red Sox, Giants, Dodgers, Yankees, Mets, Phillies, and Mariners.

title: Airlines are waiving fees, offering refunds due to reduced flight schedules
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Airlines are waiving fees and offering refunds due to FAA reducing flights by 10% at 40 U.S. airports.
JetBlue, Southwest, and United Airlines allow affected travelers to rebook or refund; restrictions on fare differences vary.
American Airlines and Delta offer flexible rebooking and refund options; terms depend on booking and travel dates.

title: After Cape Cod crash, readers say Mass. should tighten e-bike regulations
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Massachusetts residents debate stricter e-bike regulations after a Cape Cod crash injured a 69-year-old woman in September.
A Boston.com poll found 78% of 580 respondents support tougher e-bike rules, with 20% opposed, citing safety concerns.
Currently, Massachusetts defines e-bikes in two classes, with no regulations for higher-speed Class 3 bikes exceeding 20 mph.
